00022 /* standard includes. */
00023 #include <getopt.h>
00024 #include <stdio.h>
00025 #include <stdlib.h>
00026 #include <unistd.h>
00027 #include <netdb.h>
00028 #include <string.h>
00029 #include <netinet/in.h>
00030 
00031 /* local defines. */
00032 #define DEFAULT_PORT 4567       /* default port. */
00033 #define DEFAULT_HOST "localhost"        /* default host. */
00034 
00035 /* my includes. */
00036 #include "program_typedefs.h"
00037 #include "program_messages.h"
00038 
00039 /* global variables. */
00040 static const char *program_name = NULL;
00041 
00042 /* command line arguments. */
00043 static options_info input_options;
00044 options_info *fop = &input_options;
00045 
00046 /* function prototypes. */
00047 static void print_usage (FILE *, cint);
00048 static void options_init (void);
00049 void parse_options (int, char **);
00050 
00051 /* functions. */
00052 /* the following function is used to report the
00053    usage of the program and where to send bugs. */
00054 static void
00055 print_usage (FILE * stream, cint exit_code)
00056 {
00057   fprintf (stream, "%s %s %s\n", usage_part_a, program_name, usage_part_b);
00058   fprintf (stream, "\n%s", usage_part_c);
00059   fprintf (stream, "\n%s\n", usage_part_d);
00060   fprintf (stream, "%s\n", reportbugs_msg);
00061 
00062   exit (exit_code);
00063 }
00064 
00065 /* the following function sets default values
00066    for all command line arguments and options. */
00067 static void
00068 options_init (void)
00069 {
00070   /* for the program. */
00071   fop->verbose = false;
00072 
00073   /* for the client. */
00074   fop->port = (uint16_t) htons (DEFAULT_PORT);
00075   fop->hostinfo = gethostbyname (DEFAULT_HOST);
00076 }
00077 
00078 /* the following function parses
00079    input command line arguments. */
00080 void
00081 parse_options (int argc, char **argv)
00082 {
00083   /* extern necessary elements. */
00084   extern char *strdup (const char *);
00085   extern char *program_invocation_short_name;
00086 
00087   /* the next option to get. */
00088   int next_option;
00089 
00090   /* short options. */
00091   unique short_options = "z:p:v";
00092 
00093   /* long options. */
00094   const struct option long_options[] = {
00095     {"host", 1, NULL, 'z'},
00096     {"port", 1, NULL, 'p'},
00097     {"verbose", 0, NULL, 'v'},
00098     {"help", 0, NULL, 'h'},
00099     {"usage", 0, NULL, 'u'},
00100     {"version", 0, NULL, 'V'},
00101     {NULL, 0, NULL, 0}
00102   };
00103 
00104   /* get the command program name. */
00105   program_name = program_invocation_short_name;
00106 
00107   /* set default values. */
00108   options_init ();
00109 
00110   /* start scanning. */
00111   do
00112     {
00113       /* get next option. */
00114       next_option =
00115         getopt_long (argc, argv, short_options, long_options, NULL);
00116 
00117       switch (next_option)
00118         {
00119           /* print usage and exit. */
00120         case 'h':
00121         case 'u':
00122           print_usage (stdout, EXIT_SUCCESS);
00123 
00124           /* print version and exit. */
00125         case 'V':
00126           printf ("%s %s\n", package_msg, version_msg);
00127           printf ("%s %s\n", written_by_msg, developers_msg);
00128           printf ("\n%s", license_part_a);
00129           printf ("%s\n", license_part_b);
00130           printf ("%s\n", license_part_c);
00131           printf ("%s\n", reportbugs_msg);
00132           exit (EXIT_SUCCESS);
00133 
00134           /* user specified port. */
00135         case 'p':
00136           {
00137             long value;
00138             char *end;
00139 
00140             value = strtol (optarg, &end, 10);
00141 
00142             /* the user specified non-digits in the port number.  */
00143             if (*end != '\0' || value <= 0)
00144               {
00145                 fprintf (stderr, "%s\n", port_limits);
00146                 print_usage (stderr, EXIT_FAILURE);
00147               }
00148 
00149             /* the port number needs to be converted
00150                to network (big endian) byte order. */
00151             fop->port = (uint16_t) htons (value);
00152           }
00153           break;
00154 
00155           /* enable verbose mode. */
00156         case 'v':
00157           fop->verbose = true;
00158           break;
00159 
00160         case 'z':
00161           /* fetch hostname. */
00162           fop->hostinfo = gethostbyname (strdup (optarg));
00163 
00164           /* what happened? */
00165           if (fop->hostinfo == NULL)
00166             {
00167               fprintf (stderr, "%s\n\n", unknown_host);
00168               print_usage (stderr, EXIT_FAILURE);
00169             }
00170           break;
00171 
00172           /* unknown option. */
00173         case '?':
00174           print_usage (stderr, EXIT_FAILURE);
00175 
00176           /* no more options. */
00177         case -1:
00178           break;
00179 
00180         default:
00181           abort ();
00182         }
00183     }
00184   while (next_option != -1);
00185 
00186   /* the program does not take additional arguments. */
00187   if (optind != argc)
00188     {
00189       fprintf (stderr, "%s\n\n", additional_arguments);
00190       print_usage (stderr, EXIT_FAILURE);
00191     }
00192 }
